Articles.Content: Hey guys, I've been playing ksp for a little while, mostly modded, & I decided to kick myself into uninstalling mechjeb and flying things myself. Trouble is, I've run out of things to do in the game. Any ideas? I'm running a sandbox game by the way.

Depends a lot on what you've done so far, but the way I usually go about a new save:

1. Mun and Minimus

2. Duna and Ike

3. Gilly

4. Dres

5. Jool and its moons

6. Eloo or Moho

Career give lots of goals, you will also be without lot of mechjeb functions in the start.

Nice to unlock the landing autopilot while on Minmus.

jarmund you forgot 7: Eve return.

jarmund you forgot 7: Eve return.

THAT would be a goal worthy of at least one cookie!

- - - Updated - - -

Thanks. I think I'll do that with a mapping satellite constellation on each location listed in succession, then I'll set up mining bases as transfer windows appear.

jarmund you forgot 7: Eve return.

I haven't bothered trying as my computer is too potato to run the amount of parts required. I will do a proper #7 when I get a new machine, tho
Only one thing left to do, MAFman: step beyond ordinary three-dimensional reality and become a God. Start writing mods and reshaping the Kerbal universe as you see fit.
It's very fun and can get really addicting... make a ship with fuel and put heavy panels around it as armor, then attach an SRB to the front and a decoupler to launch it at enemy ships.

If you've visited most of the stock bodies and want somewhere new, it's time for a planet mod. I've been loving New Horizons, it reshuffles the existing worlds and adds a bunch of new ones and has given me some of the best challenges and most fun moments I've had in KSP for a long time.

Just keep in mind that planet packs are somewhat memory-hungry. Unless you run 64-bit KSP you'll probably have to forgo large part packs.

Well, if you don't want to leave the stock planetary system, you can always up your game and do harder stuff. Say, learn how to do gravitational assists ( far harder than it looks ) or , if you are willing to go mods, try the kOS mod and dotry a completely automated mission programmed from the start ( really hard stuff )

Build a space elevator made of kerbals on Gilly

Or try building a base on Eve
